result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Wayne Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**COMMENCE FORTHWITH**
Consecutive to 22CF554 and any other time serving.
Credit is TBD by DOC - any party disputing credit shall, within 30 days, petition the court for a hearing.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program or Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
**Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days. 
Perform 100 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: DNA
Conditions of Extended Supervision

10:40 AM Defendant Anthony Wayne Robinson in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for Anthony Wayne Robinson.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.   DE enters guilty plea. Court finds DE guilty.  PSI waived. Court imposes total sentence of 30 months WSP, 12 months IC and 18 months ES with conditions consecutive to 22CF554 and any other time served; DE not eligible for CIP or SAP;  DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court. credit is TBD by DOC - any party disputing credit shall, within 30 days, petition court for a hearing; credit applied to 22CF554 only.  Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

11:14 AM Defendant Anthony Wayne Robinson appeared by video IC.  Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for Anthony Wayne Robinson.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  Joinder motion was granted. Matters resolved.   PLEAS 9/23 1030am. Trial removed from calendar. Speedy trial demand revoked. Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Shamali.  Clerk. M.Burke. DE has no objection to Judge Rossell hearing this motion. Court permits the jointer. 22CF555 to be joined into 22CF554. State to file amended information.
for Joinder

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.    Defendant appeared by Attorney Shamali.  DE's zoom appearance waived.   Clerk HMcBride.  State may be filing a joinder motion - filed by 8/19/22.  Trial dates on both cases scheduled. If no joinder, court will proceed to JT on 22CF554 only.  JSH 9/14 11am and JS 9/19 830am.    Bond continued.
filed by Atty Shamali.

Defendant Anthony Wayne Robinson appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Shamali. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling Order
Re: 7/8/22 MO to dismiss - must file one MO for each case and MO shall be filed by DE's atty. No action taken by court.
Re: MO for Exculpatory Evidence  - motion shall be filed by DE's counsel. No action taken by court.
MO for Speedy Trial - filed prematurely and must be filed by DE's atty. Not proper and no action taken by court.

113PM  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State w/  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chad Shamali.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond continued.  Motions to be heard at next hearing.  sg

DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
